prediction.region:
Philippe, by the grace of God, King of France and Navarre, at the head of his Court of Paris or at his seat holding, salut. As many as commissioners in advance, for the sole purpose of plundering and extorting money from his peers, as much as from his predecessors and relations, in the way of his predecessors, for the last time, have already made use of this means, and still use it, to get money out of the country and his estates, from which they make yearly gain, some of them, by means of their agents, making more profit than the rest. But as they do this with so much cunning, we, who are always on the watch, have often been deceived, and the more we pay the better off we have been treated; but their greediness and extortion is always greater than their honesty. As for these officers, who are said to have conspired in such ways, the more we have proved them, the more we have been deceived; therefore we cannot put confidence in such men as they have been. And since these letters are to be made public to our said peers and relations in the Court of Paris, we, your Lordships, Commissioners, beg to make known to you what measures we have taken, and what we still propose. And if we have been deceived, we make no doubt, by reason of our good conscience, that you will at once take some measures to redress the matter and make amends to us, and to the rest of our friends and relations in our Treasury. And as to these letters being made public to our said peers and relations in the Court of Paris, we beg to make it known to you, your Lordships, that, having a due regard to our safety and property, we shall always make known to you all our transactions; and for that purpose, we hereby name the persons who are the authors of all the crimes of these officers, and whose names they are bound to keep secret. And we wish you to name to us, your Lordships, all those who are concerned in these deeds, whether as accomplices or accomplices. We shall also have recourse to your Lordships, and shall tell you all about it. Given in Paris, the twenty-eighth day of August, the three hundred and thirty-sixth year of the reign of King Charles the Sixth.

ocr.sentence: O gménu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros.
ocr.region: O gnienu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros. 569 I. GOTHŮ, 0 í o II. FRANKU, (In Hessén, am Ober-Rhein, in Franken, Schwaben, Baiern, Oesterreich, inElsass undin der Schweitz.) ^ , * III. SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet deuniverso re- gno Auslrasiorum coutra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitura. Ubi tribus turmis ťalangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutioilé Dagoberti 24

C.22. 373. ,,Gothorum rex Winitharius in Antarum fines movit pro- cinctum, eosque dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur, deinde fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum filiis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris, cruci affixit, ut dedititiis melum cadavera penden- tium geminarent.“ Jornandes, ibidem C. 28. 610 641. „Caeteri vero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitate utebantur Franci, ut lactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent. Quae res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis habebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow. Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. „Wyprawugj, že němec- kým rytjřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely.“ 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam habemus Dagoherti est, et nos, si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci zwali Wendy čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet de universo re- gno Austrasiorum contra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitum. Ubi tribus turmis falangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutione Dagoberti 24

Dagobertus superbiter jubet de universo re- gno Austrasiorum contra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitum. Ubi tribus turmis falangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Wšickni tito Germanštj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwše, wšemožně se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wětšjm djlem samy německé, swědky: Rok: 370. „Golhorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- vit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositate:pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere, i. e. Veneti, Antes, Slavi: qui quamvis nunc, ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique desaeviunt, tamen tunc omnes Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ Jornandes Eppus. Rav. de Goth. Or. C.22. 373. ,,Gothorum rex Winitharius in Antarum fines movit pro- cinctum, eosque dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur, deinde fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum filiis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris, cruci affixit, ut dedititiis melum cadavera penden- tium geminarent.“ Jornandes, ibidem C. 28. 610 641. „Caeteri vero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiam Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francis subji- ciebantur, quemadmodum et anteav dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitate utebantur Franci, ut lactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent. Quae res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis habebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow. Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. „Wyprawugj, že němec- kým rytjřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely.“ 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam habemus Dagoherti est, et nos, si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci zwali Wendy čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet de universo re- gno Austrasiorum contra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitum. Ubi tribus turmis falangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutione Dagoberti 24

ocr.sentence: “ Jornandes Eppus.
ocr.region: O gnienu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros. 569 I. GOTHŮ, 0 í o II. FRANKU, (In Hessén, am Ober-Rhein, in Franken, Schwaben, Baiern, Oesterreich, inElsass undin der Schweitz.) ^ , * III. SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet deuniverso re- gno Auslrasiorum coutra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitura. Ubi tribus turmis ťalangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutioilé Dagoberti 24

Wšickni tito Germanštj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwše, wšemožně se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wětšjm djlem samy německé, swědky: Rok: 370. „Golhorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- vit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositate:pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere, i. e. Veneti, Antes, Slavi: qui quamvis nunc, ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique desaeviunt, tamen tunc omnes Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ Jornandes Eppus. Rav. de Goth. Or. C.22. 373. ,,Gothorum rex Winitharius in Antarum fines movit pro- cinctum, eosque dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur, deinde fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum filiis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris, cruci affixit, ut dedititiis melum cadavera penden- tium geminarent.“ Jornandes, ibidem C. 28. 610 641. „Caeteri vero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiam Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francis subji- ciebantur, quemadmodum et anteav dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitate utebantur Franci, ut lactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent. Quae res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis habebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow. Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. „Wyprawugj, že němec- kým rytjřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely.“ 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam habemus Dagoherti est, et nos, si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci zwali Wendy čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet de universo re- gno Austrasiorum contra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitum. Ubi tribus turmis falangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutione Dagoberti 24

ocr.sentence: de Goth.
ocr.region: O gnienu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros. 569 I. GOTHŮ, 0 í o II. FRANKU, (In Hessén, am Ober-Rhein, in Franken, Schwaben, Baiern, Oesterreich, inElsass undin der Schweitz.) ^ , * III. SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet deuniverso re- gno Auslrasiorum coutra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitura. Ubi tribus turmis ťalangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutioilé Dagoberti 24

SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet deuniverso re- gno Auslrasiorum coutra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitura. Ubi tribus turmis ťalangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutioilé Dagoberti 24

ocr.region: O gnienu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros. 569 I. GOTHŮ, 0 í o II. FRANKU, (In Hessén, am Ober-Rhein, in Franken, Schwaben, Baiern, Oesterreich, inElsass undin der Schweitz.) ^ , * III. SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet deuniverso re- gno Auslrasiorum coutra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitura. Ubi tribus turmis ťalangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. ocr.region: O gnienu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros. 569 I. GOTHŮ, 0 í o II. FRANKU, (In Hessén, am Ober-Rhein, in Franken, Schwaben, Baiern, Oesterreich, inElsass undin der Schweitz.) ^ , * III. SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet deuniverso re- gno Auslrasiorum coutra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitura. Ubi tribus turmis ťalangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutioilé Dagoberti 24

ocr.sentence: „Wyprawugj, že němec- kým rytjřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely.
ocr.region: O gnienu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros. 569 I. GOTHŮ, 0 í o II. FRANKU, (In Hessén, am Ober-Rhein, in Franken, Schwaben, Baiern, Oesterreich, inElsass undin der Schweitz.) ^ , * III. SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. Dagobertus superbiter jubet deuniverso re- gno Auslrasiorum coutra Samonem et Winidos movere ex- ercitura. Ubi tribus turmis ťalangae super Winidos exer- citus ingreditur. Etiam et Lougobardi solutioilé Dagoberti 24

ocr.region: O gnienu Rut Ruten, Rus Ros. 569 I. GOTHŮ, 0 í o II. FRANKU, (In Hessén, am Ober-Rhein, in Franken, Schwaben, Baiern, Oesterreich, inElsass undin der Schweitz.) ^ , * III. SASU, ku kterýmž patřegj i Skcmdinawowé s gegich oddjly, totiž Dánowé, Swédowé, Norwegowé a t. d. Wsickni tito Germanstj kmenowé, naywjce pak tento poslednj, tak tlačil a odwrátil kmeny slawského národu od sebe, že tito, gegich nátisku a ukrutenstwj se zhroziwse, wšemožné se gegich panstwj sprostiti usilo- wali. Slyšme, a to wéts jm djlem samy německé, swédky: Kok: 370. „Gothorum rex Ermanaricus in Venetos arma commo- yit, qui quamvis armis disperiti, sed numerositata^pollentes, primo resistere conabantur. Hi ab una stirpe exorti, tria nunc nomina reddidere , i. e. Yeneti, Antes , Slavi: qui quamvis nunc , ita facientibus peccatis nostris, ubique clcsaeviunt, tamen tnnc omneš Ermanarici imperiis servie- re.“ J ornandes JElppus. R(iv. de Goth. O/*. C. 22. 373. „Gothorum rex Winilharius in Antarum fines niovit pro- cinctum, eosqne dum aggreditur, prima congressione su- peratur , deiade fortiter egit, regemque eorum Booz no- mine cum řiliis suis et 70 primatibus, in exemplo terro- ris , cruci ajjixit, ut dedititiis metům cadavera penden- tium geminarent. u Jornaqdes, ibidem C. 28. 610— 641. „Caeteri yero Chrobati versus Franciam (Germaniam, Saxoniam) commorabantur, parebant autem Othoni ma- gno regi Franciae quae et Saxonia. Per aliquot vero an- nos etiani Dalmátiam incolentes Chrobati, Francia subji- ciebantur, quemacknodum et anlea y dum in ipsorum ter- ra degerent. Tanta autem in ipsos crudelitcite ulebantur Franci, utlactantes adhuc eorum pueros occidentes, canibus objicerent♦ Quac res cum intolerabilis Chrobatis esset, facto dissidio, principes, quos ex ipsis babebant, intereme- runt.“ Const. Porphyr. De Adm. Im. C. 30. Srow..Králodworský Rukopis, wyd. od W. A. Swobody, w Praze, 1829. str. 44. ,,Wyprawugj, že němec kým ryljřům Pomořanky psy kogiti musely. 629. „Samo dixit, terra quam nabemus Dagoberti est, et nos , si tamen nobiscum disposuerit amicitias conservare ; Sicha- rius dicens non est possibile ut Christiani, Dei servi, cum canibus (tak Němci z wali V Vendy Čili Uny, totiž Hunde) amicitias colant. groundtruth.region: 199 Прѣди едипъ мѣсецъ нѣщо азъ видѣхъ въ градина‑ та една байнова булчица и казахъ на мама. Тя страшно се уплаши и накара слуг нята да хвърля камънье по неѭ, до гдѣто тя не се скри у една дупка въ дувара на чичови Петракеви. Тя е зихирлия, възрази кокона Тодорка. За неѭ никой нищо не може ми каза. На колцина души тя е изѣла души‑ цата, като е бълвала въ ѣстието и нощвитѣ имъ! Колцина души сѫ станѫли за подбивъ и присмѣхъ на хората, като имъ е опасвала вѣждитѣ, мустацитѣ и космитѣ? Ще ви расправѭ и за неѭ, отговори Димитръ. Когато бѣхъ още тукъ, азъ много се страхувахъ отъ байно‑ вата булчица. Покойната ни баба Гена, Богъ да ѭ прости, вечерно врѣме обичаше да ми разсказва страшни чудесии за това невинно животно. Тя ми казваше, че булчицата, както казва и мама, опасвала на хората мустацитѣ и вѣждитѣ и бълвала въ нощвитѣ и ѣстиета нѣкаква си отрова, отъ която, щомъ хапне нѣкой, умиралъ. Пом ѭ добрѣ, че тя ме бѣше научила пѣколко думи, които като чуела байновата булчица, божемъ, избѣгвала. Тѣзи думи, до колкото помнѭ сѫ : «Дайте на булчицата хурчицата, да си испреде и истъче, че ѝ се скѫсалъ кожуха». Вижда се работата, хората мислѭтъ, че булчицата бѣга отъ хурката, като младитѣ булки, та за‑ това ѝ прѣдлагатъ хурка, дано да избѣга. Азъ веднъжъ ви‑ дѣхъ на двора една булчица и толкова се оплашихъ, щото за‑ хванѫхъ да викамъ колкото ме държи сила наученитѣ отъ баба думи. Бѣдното животно сѣднѫ на заднитѣ си крака, издигнѫ си главата, погледнѫ учудено и побѣтнѫ. Отидохъ горѣ. Съ голѣмо нетърпѣние чакахъ азъ деня, въ който щѣше да ни говори профессорътъ за булчицата. Той донесе на лекцията ед‑ на жива и много питомна булчица, която, както ни каза той, държалъ въ кѫщата си вмѣсто котка. Азъ веднъжъ отидохъ у дома му и имахъ възможность да видѭ пакъ булчицата. Тя спѣше винѫги на кревата му и, щомъ чуеше да дращи нѣгдѣ нѣкоя мишка, тутакъ отиваше и слѣдъ малко се вра‑ щаше съ мишка въ устата. На лекцията профессорътъ тъй хвали булчицата, щото азъ положително не вѣрвахъ на уши‑ тѣ си. Това животно е много полезно, защото ѣде само миш‑ ки, съсели и суеци. Погледнѣте само на тѣлото му вий ще видите, че то е тънко и дълго и дава на животното въз‑ мож ость да се провира въ най тѣснитѣ дунки, въ които са‑ о може да се провре мишка. Веднъжъ, помнѭ, стоехме нѣ‑

За неѭ никой нищо не може ми каза. На колцина души тя е изѣла души‑ цата, като е бълвала въ ѣстието и нощвитѣ имъ! Колцина души сѫ станѫли за подбивъ и присмѣхъ на хората, като имъ е опасвала вѣждитѣ, мустацитѣ и космитѣ? Ще ви расправѭ и за неѭ, отговори Димитръ. Когато бѣхъ още тукъ, азъ много се страхувахъ отъ байно‑ вата булчица. Покойната ни баба Гена, Богъ да ѭ прости, вечерно врѣме обичаше да ми разсказва страшни чудесии за това невинно животно. Тя ми казваше, че булчицата, както казва и мама, опасвала на хората мустацитѣ и вѣждитѣ и бълвала въ нощвитѣ и ѣстиета нѣкаква си отрова, отъ която, щомъ хапне нѣкой, умиралъ. Пом ѭ добрѣ, че тя ме бѣше научила пѣколко думи, които като чуела байновата булчица, божемъ, избѣгвала. Тѣзи думи, до колкото помнѭ сѫ : «Дайте на булчицата хурчицата, да си испреде и истъче, че ѝ се скѫсалъ кожуха». Вижда се работата, хората мислѭтъ, че булчицата бѣга отъ хурката, като младитѣ булки, та за‑ това ѝ прѣдлагатъ хурка, дано да избѣга. Азъ веднъжъ ви‑ дѣхъ на двора една булчица и толкова се оплашихъ, щото за‑ хванѫхъ да викамъ колкото ме държи сила наученитѣ отъ баба думи. Бѣдното животно сѣднѫ на заднитѣ си крака, издигнѫ си главата, погледнѫ учудено и побѣтнѫ. Отидохъ горѣ. Съ голѣмо нетърпѣние чакахъ азъ деня, въ който щѣше да ни говори профессорътъ за булчицата. Той донесе на лекцията ед‑ на жива и много питомна булчица, която, както ни каза той, държалъ въ кѫщата си вмѣсто котка. Азъ веднъжъ отидохъ у дома му и имахъ възможность да видѭ пакъ булчицата. Тя спѣше винѫги на кревата му и, щомъ чуеше да дращи нѣгдѣ нѣкоя мишка, тутакъ отиваше и слѣдъ малко се вра‑ щаше съ мишка въ устата. На лекцията профессорътъ тъй хвали булчицата, щото азъ положително не вѣрвахъ на уши‑ тѣ си. Това животно е много полезно, защото ѣде само миш‑ ки, съсели и суеци. Погледнѣте само на тѣлото му вий ще видите, че то е тънко и дълго и дава на животното въз‑ мож ость да се провира въ най тѣснитѣ дунки, въ които са‑ о може да се провре мишка. Азъ веднъжъ ви‑ дѣхъ на двора една булчица и толкова се оплашихъ, щото за‑ хванѫхъ да викамъ колкото ме държи сила наученитѣ отъ баба думи. Бѣдното животно сѣднѫ на заднитѣ си крака, издигнѫ си главата, погледнѫ учудено и побѣтнѫ. Отидохъ горѣ. Съ голѣмо нетърпѣние чакахъ азъ деня, въ който щѣше да ни говори профессорътъ за булчицата. На лекцията профессорътъ тъй хвали булчицата, щото азъ положително не вѣрвахъ на уши‑ тѣ си. Това животно е много полезно, защото ѣде само миш‑ ки, съсели и суеци. Тя ми казваше, че булчицата, както казва и мама, опасвала на хората мустацитѣ и вѣждитѣ и бълвала въ нощвитѣ и ѣстиета нѣкаква си отрова, отъ която, щомъ хапне нѣкой, умиралъ. Пом ѭ добрѣ, че тя ме бѣше научила пѣколко думи, които като чуела байновата булчица, божемъ, избѣгвала. Бѣдното животно сѣднѫ на заднитѣ си крака, издигнѫ си главата, погледнѫ учудено и побѣтнѫ. Отидохъ горѣ. Съ голѣмо нетърпѣние чакахъ азъ деня, въ който щѣше да ни говори профессорътъ за булчицата. На лекцията профессорътъ тъй хвали булчицата, щото азъ положително не вѣрвахъ на уши‑ тѣ си. Това животно е много полезно, защото ѣде само миш‑ ки, съсели и суеци. groundtruth.region: 199 Прѣди едипъ мѣсецъ нѣщо азъ видѣхъ въ градина‑ та една байнова булчица и казахъ на мама. Тя страшно се уплаши и накара слуг нята да хвърля камънье по неѭ, до гдѣто тя не се скри у една дупка въ дувара на чичови Петракеви. Тя е зихирлия, възрази кокона Тодорка. За неѭ никой нищо не може ми каза. На колцина души тя е изѣла души‑ цата, като е бълвала въ ѣстието и нощвитѣ имъ! Колцина души сѫ станѫли за подбивъ и присмѣхъ на хората, като имъ е опасвала вѣждитѣ, мустацитѣ и космитѣ? Ще ви расправѭ и за неѭ, отговори Димитръ. Когато бѣхъ още тукъ, азъ много се страхувахъ отъ байно‑ вата булчица. Покойната ни баба Гена, Богъ да ѭ прости, вечерно врѣме обичаше да ми разсказва страшни чудесии за това невинно животно. Тя ми казваше, че булчицата, както казва и мама, опасвала на хората мустацитѣ и вѣждитѣ и бълвала въ нощвитѣ и ѣстиета нѣкаква си отрова, отъ която, щомъ хапне нѣкой, умиралъ. Пом ѭ добрѣ, че тя ме бѣше научила пѣколко думи, които като чуела байновата булчица, божемъ, избѣгвала. Тѣзи думи, до колкото помнѭ сѫ : «Дайте на булчицата хурчицата, да си испреде и истъче, че ѝ се скѫсалъ кожуха». Азъ веднъжъ ви‑ дѣхъ на двора една булчица и толкова се оплашихъ, щото за‑ хванѫхъ да викамъ колкото ме държи сила наученитѣ отъ баба думи. Бѣдното животно сѣднѫ на заднитѣ си крака, издигнѫ си главата, погледнѫ учудено и побѣтнѫ. Отидохъ горѣ. Съ голѣмо нетърпѣние чакахъ азъ деня, въ който щѣше да ни говори профессорътъ за булчицата. Той донесе на лекцията ед‑ на жива и много питомна булчица, която, както ни каза той, държалъ въ кѫщата си вмѣсто котка. Азъ веднъжъ отидохъ у дома му и имахъ възможность да видѭ пакъ булчицата. На лекцията профессорътъ тъй хвали булчицата, щото азъ положително не вѣрвахъ на уши‑ тѣ си. Това животно е много полезно, защото ѣде само миш‑ ки, съсели и суеци. groundtruth.region: eine deutſche Philoſophie ſich uͤber die andre gebaut.einer weiten Lebensreiſe haben ſie auf alles zuruͤck hier und dort derſelbe iſt, ſondern die ſchlechte Dorf tern von der Gnade Geraͤuſch und uͤbertaͤuben ſichlebendiges Denken an ſeine Stelle treten zu laſſen,die wahren Vortheile des Syſtems auf.iſt weder an eine vollkommene Theokratie noch anheiligt, aber nochmals in ſuͤndigen Abfall und Ver nicht auch Auswendiglernen und Abſchreiben verbo tentheils nur als politiſche Geſchichte betrachtet wird,Man hat in den neueſten Zeiten das Schaͤdliche,279Dunkel jener Kirche eine gewiſſe Aufklaͤrung zu ver Die Dogmatiker haben aber den Kritikern noch im den Separatiſten.der auf. Die Phantaſie mag uns in einem Augen nicht gewinnen. Wo man ſtehn bleibt, iſt ganz einer Geſchichtſchreiber noch viel zu wuͤnſchen uͤbrig, ſieſchen eine phantaſtiſche Nation, im Mittelalter wur haben wir ſelbſt zu Stande gebracht. Die fortge venienz der Gallomanie an dem derben Humor derden Thorſchreiber herab die Gemeindeverwaltung anSchutz, den die proteſtantiſche Kirche gewaͤhrte, ge Seine Schuͤler zeigen oft nur dem Syſtem zu Liebeder Leidenſchaften bewaͤltigt, ſo laͤugnet er die Of kiſcher Muſik bachantiſche Taͤnze um den Altar derders machen.chen ſcheint, daß ſie die Entzweiung ihrer Gegnergeſucht. Es gab ſogar eine « natuͤrliche Geſchichte desBetrachten wir die Orthodoxie noch zu Anfangzuſtanden, und es waͤre zu wuͤnſchen, daß daruͤberrielle Exiſtenz zu thun. Jene ſind daher ſtreng ge

ocr.sentence: remos, que no permitio Dios que a quel galpon se qúemasse aquella no che, ni otras muchas noches y dias que procuraron quemar lo que por estas marauillas y otras semejantes que el señor hizo paraque su fe Ca- tholica entrara en aquel imperio, lo ganaron los Españoles.
ocr.region: COMMENTARIOS REALES. remos,que lio permitió Dios que a quel galpón fe quemaste aquella no che,ni otras muchas noches y dias que procuraron quemar lo que por estas marauülas y otras lemejantes que el señor hizo paraque iu fe Ca * tholíca entrara en aquel imperio,lo ganaron los Españoles. L ambien referuaronel templo del sol y la ca sa de las virgines escogidas todo lo demás quemaron , por quemar los Españoles. QJf. XI Los barrios y cafas que ay al po niente del arroyo, Odo lo cj hemos dicho de las cafas reales y pobiazo de aquella cíu - dad estauaal críe te delarroyo,que pasta por medio delia, Al poniente del arroyo esta la pia^a q líamanCussípata,q es ande de alegría y regozíjo. En tiempo de los Incas aquellas dos placas estalla hechas vna,todo el arroyo estaua cu bierto con Vigas gruesas, y encima dellas losas grandes para hazer fue Jo, porq acudían cantos Señores de vaíTallos a las fiestas principales q hazian al íol,que no cabía en la pía ^a que llamamos principal :por esto la ensancharon con otra poco me nos grande que ella. El arroyo cu brieron con Vigas porque no supie ron hazer boueda . Los Españoles gastaron la madera,y dexaronqua- tro puentes a trechos que yo alean ce, y eran también de madera. Des pués hízieron tres de boueda que *77 yo dexe . Aquellas dos pla5as en mis tiempos no estauan díuidídas, ni tenían cafas a vna parte y a otra del arroyo como aora las tienen . El año de mili v quinientos y cin- quenta y cinco , siendo corregidor Garcilaílo de Ja Vega mí Señor fe labraron, y adjudicaron para pro- priosde la ciudad, que la triste aun que aula sido Señora y Emperatriz de aquel grande imperio, no tema entonces vn marauedi de renca; no fe lo que tiene aora . Al poniente de) arroyo no auían hecho Edifici os los Reyes Incas, solo auia el cer codelos arrabales que hemos di cho * Tenían guardado aquel sitio, paraque los Reyes succestores hi- zieran íus caías como auían hecho los pastados , que auncj es verdad q las calas de los antecessores, rabien eran de los fuceífores,ellos rnanda- uan labrar por grandeza y magef- tad otras para si,porque retuuiesten. el nombre del que las mado labrar como rodas las demás cofas que ha zian, que no perdían los nobres de los Incas fus dueños: lo quai no de- xa de ser particular grandeza de a- qucllos Reyes,Los Españoles labra ron fus caías en aquel sitio,las qua- les yremosdeziendo , siguiendo eí Viage norte sur como ellas están, y cuyas eran quando yo las dexe. Baxando con el arroyo desde la puerca Ailacapuncu,las primeras ca fas eran de Pedro de Orne luego fe guían las de luán de Paücoruo,y en ella víuía Alonso de Marehena,que a vn que tenía Yndíosno qría luán de Pan corno q v hueste en otra cafa por la mucha y antigua amistad q siépretimicron.Siguiendo el mismo viage calleen.medíovestan las cafas 2 qua 1 © Biblioteca Nacional de España

Los Españoles labra ron sus casas en aquel fftio, las qua- les yremos deziendo, ffguiendo el Viage norte sur como ellas estan, y cuyas eran quando yo las dexe. Luego se hizo huir de aquel sitio los Reyes, en la fiesta de los tres Reyes, que en el año de mili vuestros a vuestros Reyes de otoños y noviembre, y las últimas de las fiestas principales, como unos señores, como unos hombres de huir de aquel arroyo, que quemaron y quemaron y quemaron ; y así quemaron los Reyes Incas, y así quemaron en aquel sitio los Reyes Incas, y así quemaron las calas de los Reyes Incas, y como les quemo, dejó la tierra huida en el arroyo, como ya esta, y la tierra huida en el arroyo, como vuestra gente, es vuestra gente como quemaron aquel sitio, y la tierra huida en el arroyo. En tiempo de los Incas aquellas dos placas estalla hechas vna,todo el arroyo estaua cu bierto con Vigas gruesas, y encima dellas losas grandes para hazer fue Jo, porq acudían cantos Señores de vaíTallos a las fiestas principales q hazian al íol,que no cabía en la pía ^a que llamamos principal :por esto la ensancharon con otra poco me nos grande que ella. El arroyo cu brieron con Vigas porque no supie ron hazer boueda . Los Españoles gastaron la madera,y dexaronqua- tro puentes a trechos que yo alean ce, y eran también de madera. Des pués hízieron tres de boueda que *77 yo dexe . Aquellas dos pla5as en mis tiempos no estauan díuidídas, ni tenían cafas a vna parte y a otra del arroyo como aora las tienen . Baxando con el arroyo desde la puerca Ailacapuncu,las primeras ca fas eran de Pedro de Orne luego fe guían las de luán de Paücoruo,y en ella víuía Alonso de Marehena,que a vn que tenía Yndíosno qría luán de Pan corno q v hueste en otra cafa por la mucha y antigua amistad q siépretimicron.Siguiendo el mismo viage calleen.medíovestan las cafas 2 qua 1 © Biblioteca Nacional de España

ocr.sentence: El arroyo cu- brieron con Vigas porque no supie ron hazer boueda .
ocr.region: COMMENTARIOS REALES. remos,que lio permitió Dios que a quel galpón fe quemaste aquella no che,ni otras muchas noches y dias que procuraron quemar lo que por estas marauülas y otras lemejantes que el señor hizo paraque iu fe Ca * tholíca entrara en aquel imperio,lo ganaron los Españoles. L ambien referuaronel templo del sol y la ca sa de las virgines escogidas todo lo demás quemaron , por quemar los Españoles. QJf. XI Los barrios y cafas que ay al po niente del arroyo, Odo lo cj hemos dicho de las cafas reales y pobiazo de aquella cíu - dad estauaal críe te delarroyo,que pasta por medio delia, Al poniente del arroyo esta la pia^a q líamanCussípata,q es ande de alegría y regozíjo. En tiempo de los Incas aquellas dos placas estalla hechas vna,todo el arroyo estaua cu bierto con Vigas gruesas, y encima dellas losas grandes para hazer fue Jo, porq acudían cantos Señores de vaíTallos a las fiestas principales q hazian al íol,que no cabía en la pía ^a que llamamos principal :por esto la ensancharon con otra poco me nos grande que ella. El arroyo cu brieron con Vigas porque no supie ron hazer boueda . Los Españoles gastaron la madera,y dexaronqua- tro puentes a trechos que yo alean ce, y eran también de madera. Des pués hízieron tres de boueda que *77 yo dexe . Aquellas dos pla5as en mis tiempos no estauan díuidídas, ni tenían cafas a vna parte y a otra del arroyo como aora las tienen . El año de mili v quinientos y cin- quenta y cinco , siendo corregidor Garcilaílo de Ja Vega mí Señor fe labraron, y adjudicaron para pro- priosde la ciudad, que la triste aun que aula sido Señora y Emperatriz de aquel grande imperio, no tema entonces vn marauedi de renca; no fe lo que tiene aora . Al poniente de) arroyo no auían hecho Edifici os los Reyes Incas, solo auia el cer codelos arrabales que hemos di cho * Tenían guardado aquel sitio, paraque los Reyes succestores hi- zieran íus caías como auían hecho los pastados , que auncj es verdad q las calas de los antecessores, rabien eran de los fuceífores,ellos rnanda- uan labrar por grandeza y magef- tad otras para si,porque retuuiesten. el nombre del que las mado labrar como rodas las demás cofas que ha zian, que no perdían los nobres de los Incas fus dueños: lo quai no de- xa de ser particular grandeza de a- qucllos Reyes,Los Españoles labra ron fus caías en aquel sitio,las qua- les yremosdeziendo , siguiendo eí Viage norte sur como ellas están, y cuyas eran quando yo las dexe. Baxando con el arroyo desde la puerca Ailacapuncu,las primeras ca fas eran de Pedro de Orne luego fe guían las de luán de Paücoruo,y en ella víuía Alonso de Marehena,que a vn que tenía Yndíosno qría luán de Pan corno q v hueste en otra cafa por la mucha y antigua amistad q siépretimicron.Siguiendo el mismo viage calleen.medíovestan las cafas 2 qua 1 © Biblioteca Nacional de España

The Duke of Burgundy, who was famous for his beauty and his wit, and who was also the nephew of the Archbishop of Bourges, is described in these lines as the "lover of the fair one," and is said to have done penance for a similar crime.
The duke was said to have had a very large collection of books, and a roll of parchment with many curious illustrations, which he took out on occasions of great emotion.
The poet is here inveighing against the use of the old roll, because it is said to have been rolled out on the stage of the "Stratford Shakespeare," and because it was thought to bear on the subject of the play.
The poem is also dedicated to the Duke, and he is therefore addressed as "my dear duke."
The poet does not seem to have been aware that he had written any of this poem, because he refers to the "Stratford Shakespeare" in the third line of the second stanza, and to the "Bambino," which was the name of the hero of a play which appeared in the "Stratford" on the 5th of May, 1598, in the following stanza, without having had the least idea of his work being there represented.
The title of the piece is "Sto-Cate-Forty-five-or-fifty, or, how the Bard's Books became a Book-Roll." It contains about fifty-two lines.
The printer of this MS. (probably in Holland) was the Hans Schottius.
It is from this MS. that the second stanza of the first edition of the "Bard's Tales" was taken.
The poem is printed at the beginning of the first edition of this book.</s>

prediction.region:
The Duke of Burgundy, who was famous for his beauty and his wit, and who was also the nephew of the Archbishop of Bourges, is described in these lines as the "lover of the fair one," and is said to have done penance for a similar crime.
The duke was said to have had a very large collection of books, and a roll of parchment with many curious illustrations, which he took out on occasions of great emotion.
The poet is here inveighing against the use of the old roll, because it is said to have been rolled out on the stage of the "Stratford Shakespeare," and because it was thought to bear on the subject of the play.
The poem is also dedicated to the Duke, and he is therefore addressed as "my dear duke."
The poet does not seem to have been aware that he had written any of this poem, because he refers to the "Stratford Shakespeare" in the third line of the second stanza, and to the "Bambino," which was the name of the hero of a play which appeared in the "Stratford" on the 5th of May, 1598, in the following stanza, without having had the least idea of his work being there represented.
The title of the piece is "Sto-Cate-Forty-five-or-fifty, or, how the Bard's Books became a Book-Roll." It contains about fifty-two lines.
The printer of this MS. (probably in Holland) was the Hans Schottius.
It is from this MS. that the second stanza of the first edition of the "Bard's Tales" was taken.
The poem is printed at the beginning of the first edition of this book.</s>

The duke was said to have had a very large collection of books, and a roll of parchment with many curious illustrations, which he took out on occasions of great emotion.
The poet is here inveighing against the use of the old roll, because it is said to have been rolled out on the stage of the "Stratford Shakespeare," and because it was thought to bear on the subject of the play.
The poem is also dedicated to the Duke, and he is therefore addressed as "my dear duke."
The poet does not seem to have been aware that he had written any of this poem, because he refers to the "Stratford Shakespeare" in the third line of the second stanza, and to the "Bambino," which was the name of the hero of a play which appeared in the "Stratford" on the 5th of May, 1598, in the following stanza, without having had the least idea of his work being there represented.
The title of the piece is "Sto-Cate-Forty-five-or-fifty, or, how the Bard's Books became a Book-Roll." It contains about fifty-two lines.
The printer of this MS. (probably in Holland) was the Hans Schottius.
It is from this MS. that the second stanza of the first edition of the "Bard's Tales" was taken.
The poem is printed at the beginning of the first edition of this book.</s>

Zwar würden auf den Gewerkſchafts-Kongreſſen, dieſtände können jederzeit zu ſeiner Entlaſſung führen. Dann aberJdeen gewinnen, da er fortwährend mit ihm zuſammen iſt. Erorganiſationen haben derartige Unterſtützungen nicht, oder dochhöherer Beiträge erzogen werden, wollen ſie durch den gewerk Produktion binnen Kurzem in den Händen von Kartellen ſeinwird entweder zur Vergrößerung der Anlagen verwandt, oderEinleitung.genau ſo oder doch ähnlich liegen waren in folgenden Bran direkt einen Einfluß auf den Arbeitsmarkt,den Organiſationen ohne Arbeitsloſen-Unterſtützung die erzieltenzur Genüge bewieſen. Trotzdem die allgemeine Geſchäftslageweſens beſeitigt. Jn Deutſchland, wo das Klaſſenbewußtſein,iſt begreiflich. Namentlich das vergangene Jahr hat dieſes wiederStandpunkte ſtehen bleiben. Dannfür die Organiſationen thätig waren, ſind längſt von der Bild einigen Orten iſt man mit der Gewerbeinſpektion in VerbindungBewegung keine große Bedeutung bei, weil ſie annehmen, daß Jn Berlin haben in letzterer Zeit einige Verwaltungsſtellenwerkſchaften ſich im Kreiſe herumdrehen.wiſſen, daß ſie ſonſt ſofort hinausfliegen und dann dem Hunger

I was born in 1782, and was baptized at Schönberg in 1783. During the winter of 1784 I was left by my mother in the care of a countrywoman, who, as I subsequently learned, was of noble birth and was called _the Fair Child_, and who, I suppose, in her youth was handsome. The fair one had a large and richly decorated room in which she kept horses, and in which she trained her animals to be ridden and to draw carts; the fair one was rich in all that was noble, and she made no secret of her wealth, for the world is too full of fools to be grateful for what is merely natural.
I was then but three years old. When I reached the age of four I was sent to the gymnasium, and while in it I became acquainted with a girl named _Maren_, who was of the same age as myself, and who was very pretty; but as the fair one was still at home, she took me to her and took charge of me. Then _Maren_ became more friendly to me, and we were very intimate together, but when we were twelve years of age the fair one made some complaints to my parents about us, and the matter was mentioned to me. I made no remark about it, and _Maren_ was very angry. She soon grew much more intimate with me than she had been before, but one day when _Maren_ and I were together she made a remark about the _Fair Child_, and that remark was that she was ugly, so that this made _Maren_ extremely angry. I replied that this could not be, for she was a fair one. Then we began to quarrel, and this went on for two days. During the first day, which was a Saturday, my father was at home, and after dinner the fair one came to us with a piece of cloth, which she said was a large piece of woollen cloth that had been thrown away; she said that I ought to have a coat made from it, as I was so little. I said, "No," and refused, but she insisted, and then I began to quarrel with her about it. Then she began to abuse me, saying that I should have a coat made from it, and I answered that if she should give me anything I would not wear it, and she had no right to give it to me. But she persisted, and finally I went into my room, and when I came back out of it she was still there. Then we began to quarrel more violently, and then we were obliged to go to the chamberlain and complain against each other. The chamberlain told us to go and arrange it at once, for we were not to quarrel in his house, but we remained quarrelling for another day and a half; but when I was about to go away from the chamberlain, the fair one said that she would speak to my father and mother about it, and she was very angry. Then I promised not to quarrel any more, and she went away. That was the end of my acquaintance with the fair one; I have not

I was born in 1782, and was baptized at Schönberg in 1783. During the winter of 1784 I was left by my mother in the care of a countrywoman, who, as I subsequently learned, was of noble birth and was called _the Fair Child_, and who, I suppose, in her youth was handsome. The fair one had a large and richly decorated room in which she kept horses, and in which she trained her animals to be ridden and to draw carts; the fair one was rich in all that was noble, and she made no secret of her wealth, for the world is too full of fools to be grateful for what is merely natural.
I was then but three years old. When I reached the age of four I was sent to the gymnasium, and while in it I became acquainted with a girl named _Maren_, who was of the same age as myself, and who was very pretty; but as the fair one was still at home, she took me to her and took charge of me. Then _Maren_ became more friendly to me, and we were very intimate together, but when we were twelve years of age the fair one made some complaints to my parents about us, and the matter was mentioned to me. I made no remark about it, and _Maren_ was very angry. She soon grew much more intimate with me than she had been before, but one day when _Maren_ and I were together she made a remark about the _Fair Child_, and that remark was that she was ugly, so that this made _Maren_ extremely angry. I replied that this could not be, for she was a fair one. Then we began to quarrel, and this went on for two days. During the first day, which was a Saturday, my father was at home, and after dinner the fair one came to us with a piece of cloth, which she said was a large piece of woollen cloth that had been thrown away; she said that I ought to have a coat made from it, as I was so little. I said, "No," and refused, but she insisted, and then I began to quarrel with her about it. Then she began to abuse me, saying that I should have a coat made from it, and I answered that if she should give me anything I would not wear it, and she had no right to give it to me. But she persisted, and finally I went into my room, and when I came back out of it she was still there. Then we began to quarrel more violently, and then we were obliged to go to the chamberlain and complain against each other. The chamberlain told us to go and arrange it at once, for we were not to quarrel in his house, but we remained quarrelling for another day and a half; but when I was about to go away from the chamberlain, the fair one said that she would speak to my father and mother about it, and she was very angry. C8gibt but in the best, we conform to the reformed Congregation, which was considered to be one of the most important, because it provided for a more comprehensive examination of the doctrine of the reformers. The question of baptismal regeneration was put to the test in the context of the more moderate tendencies in the Church. A great deal of attention was paid to the question of the constitution of the German Church, and the struggle for a centralization of power was accompanied by an increase in the power of the bishops. The new policy on behalf of the Protestants was based on the assumption that the liberal parties would be able to exert influence on the bishops. But in the beginning the reformers were not inclined to support this plan, as they were not prepared to have their influence exercised only through the influence of the bishops. However, the fact that they did not oppose the establishment of the State Church by the reformers showed that they were willing to sacrifice this point to a greater unity of purpose. Therefore, the first step towards the formation of a unified Church of Germany was taken, but it was not easy. In the end, a solution of the question of church organization was found, which at the same time ensured the authority of the bishops, and was acceptable to the liberals and the conservatives.</s>

Wenn beherzigt und in dem vielfach umge geſchloſſen und verſiegelt, und ſo lange die Pfortenſteuer von dem verarmten Winzer forderte, daß die die fehlende Stimme zur Execution erlangen wird;dieſer Wurzel durch die Sanktion der ganzen Vergan niſſen aufdringe, da aber wo es Beiden Eintrag thut,169Man hat dem Thäter frevelhaften Hochmuth vorge hier nur im Allgemeinen angegeben, bis zum Beſon der Betheiligten geiſtliche Stiftungen aufgehoben wur ſten erſchüttert wurde. C8gibt but in the best, we conform to the reformed Congregation, which was considered to be one of the most important, because it provided for a more comprehensive examination of the doctrine of the reformers. The question of baptismal regeneration was put to the test in the context of the more moderate tendencies in the Church. A great deal of attention was paid to the question of the constitution of the German Church, and the struggle for a centralization of power was accompanied by an increase in the power of the bishops. The new policy on behalf of the Protestants was based on the assumption that the liberal parties would be able to exert influence on the bishops. But in the beginning the reformers were not inclined to support this plan, as they were not prepared to have their influence exercised only through the influence of the bishops. However, the fact that they did not oppose the establishment of the State Church by the reformers showed that they were willing to sacrifice this point to a greater unity of purpose. Therefore, the first step towards the formation of a unified Church of Germany was taken, but it was not easy. In the end, a solution of the question of church organization was found, which at the same time ensured the authority of the bishops, and was acceptable to the liberals and the conservatives.</s>

ocr.sentence: Johannes, Dei gratia, Francorum rex.
ocr.region: Johannes, Dei gratia Francorum rex. Notum facimus universis, tam presentibus quam futuris, quod provi nobis humiliter fuit expositum ex parte amicorum carnalium Hugonis Guiberti, filii Thome Guiberti, quod cum guerris durantibus ecclesia de Bellou in Pictavia per gentes nostras in dictis partibus exisentes, quodem modo fuisset debilitata ne forsita inomici eandem fortificarent. nichilominus Anglici et alii inimici regni nostri de die in diem predictum locum accupare volebant, prout vot et fama laborabant, quod attendenter parrochi dicte ecclesie et alii circonitivi timentes ne forsitam dicti inimici, se ibidem ntiidenere dictusque Hugo ad requestem plurium parrochianorum predictorum, una cum eisdem dictam ecclesiam fortificaverunt causa sue tuicionis, et eandem contra dictos inimicos ben deffenderunt et pro eo pluria victualia et alia bona mobilia in et super paria acceperunt, cumque carissimus primogenitus noster, dux Norman, dum nobis absentibus regnum nostrum regebat pace refor mata inter nos et carissimum fratrem nostrum regem Anglie fecerit generalem abolucionem criminum guerris durantibus commissorum prosecucione civili partibus reservata, dictusque Hugo ad instigacionem suorum emulorum, occasione premissorum posset forsi tam in futurum accusari vel vexari, et propter hoc nobis humiliter supplicarant, ut cum ipse Hugo hactenus fuerit bone fame velimus eidem super hoc nostre misericordie gremium apparire. nos, attentis et consideratis premissis predicto Hugoni facta supradicta ac cetera omnia alia que sub dicta generali abolucione possunt et debent comprehandi, civili prosecucione dutapat partibus reserva ta atque omnem penam corporalem, criminalem et ciivilem, quas erga nos, occasione premissorum potuerit quomodolibet incur risse, remittimus, quittamus ac tenore presencium penitus in dulgemus in casu premisso, ipsumque restituimus ad famam patriam et bona. Dantes, tenore presentium in mandatis senescall Pictavensis ceterisque justiciariis, officiaris nostris aut eorum loca tenentibus, presentibus pariter et futurus, quatinus dictum Hugonem, nostra presenti gracia uti et gaudere pacifice faciant et permittant ipsum in contrarium nullatenus molestantis aut molestari quomodolibet permittentes, sed si quis de bonis suis propter hoc captum seu saisitum extitit eidem volumus restitui indilate, quicquid secus factum vel attemptatum fuerit ad statum pristinum et debitum celeriter reducendo. Quod ut firmum et stabile permaneat in futurum, presentes litteras sigilli nostri mi miine facimus roborari. Salvo in aliis jure nostro et in omnibus quolibet alieno. Actum et Datum Parisius, anno Domini m coclx, mense juiii. Per regem, ad relacionem consilii in quo vos eratis. ferricus.

groundtruth.sentence: Johannes, Dei gratia Francorum rex.
groundtruth.region: Johannes, Dei gratia, Francorum rex. Notum facimus universis, tam presentibus quam futuris, quod, prout nobis humiliter fuit expositum ex parte amicorum carnalium Hugonis Guiberti, filii Thome Guiberti, quod cum guerris durantibus ecclesia de Bellou in Pictavia per gentes nostras in dictis partibus existentes quodam modo fuisset debilitata, ne forsitan inimici eandem fortificarent, nichilominus Anglici et alii inimici regni nostri de die in diem predictum locum occupare volebant, prout vox et fama laborabant, quod attendentes parrochiani dicte ecclesie et alii circonvicini, timentes ne forsitan dicti inimici se ibidem manutenerent, dictus que Hugo, ad requestam plurium parrochianorum predictorum, una cum eisdem dictam ecclesiam fortificaverunt, causa sue tuicionis, et eandem contra dictos inimicos bene deffenderunt et pro eo pluria victualia et alia bona mobilia in et super patria acceperunt ; cum que carissimus primogenitus noster, dux Normannie, dum nobis absentibus regnum nostrum regebat, pace reformata inter nos et carissimum fratrem nostrum regem Anglie, fecerit generalem absolucionem criminum guerris durantibus commissorum, prosecucione civili partibus reservata, dictusque Hugo, ad instigacionem suorum emulorum, occasione premissorum posset forsitam in futurum accusari vel vexari ; et propter hoc nobis humiliter supplicarunt ut, cumipse Hugo hactenus fuerit bone fame, velimus eidem super hoc nostre misericordie gremium apperire. Nos, attentis et consideratis premissis, prediclo litigoni facta supradicta ac cetera omnia alia, que sub dicta generali absolucione possunt et debent comprehandi, civili prosecucione duntaxat partibus reservata, atque omnem penam corporalem, criminalem et civilem, quas erga nos occasione premissorum potuerit quomodolibet incurrisse, remittimus, quittamus ac tenore presencium penitus indulgemus in casu premisso, ipsumque restituimus ad famam, patriam et bona. Dantes tenore presentium in mandatis senescallo Pictavensi ceterisque justiciariis, et officiariis nostris, atit eorum locatenentibus, presentibus pariter et futuris, quatinus dictum Hugonem nostra presenti gratia uti et gaudere pacifice faciant et permittant, ipsum in contrarium nullatenus molestantes aut molestari quomodolibet permitentes, sed si quis de bonis suis propter hoc captum seu saisitum extiterit eidem volumus restitui indilate, quodquid secus factum vel actemptatum fuerit ad statum prestinum et debitum celerint reducendo. Quod ut firmum et stabile permaneat in futurum, presentes litteras sigilli nostri munimine fecimus roborari. Salvo in aliis jure nostro et in omnibus quolibet alieno. Actum et dalum Parisius, anno Domini moccc lxio, mense junii. Per regem, ad relacionem consilii in quo vos eratis. Ferricus.

Incorrect text: Notum facimus universis, tam presentibus quam futuris, quod, prout nobis humiliter fuit expositum ex parte amicorum carnalium Hugonis Guiberti, filii Thome Guiberti, quod cum guerris durantibus ecclesia de Bellou in Pictavia per gentes nostras in dictis partibus existentes quodam modo fuisset debilitata, ne forsitan inimici eandem fortificarent, nichilominus Anglici et alii inimici regni nostri de die in diem predictum locum occupare volebant, prout vox et fama laborabant, quod attendentes parrochiani dicte ecclesie et alii circonvicini, timentes ne forsitan dicti inimici se ibidem manutenerent, dictus que Hugo, ad requestam plurium parrochianorum predictorum, una cum eisdem dictam ecclesiam fortificaverunt, causa sue tuicionis, et eandem contra dictos inimicos bene deffenderunt et pro eo pluria victualia et alia bona mobilia in et super patria acceperunt ; cum que carissimus primogenitus noster, dux Normannie, dum nobis absentibus regnum nostrum regebat, pace reformata inter nos et carissimum fratrem nostrum regem Anglie, fecerit generalem absolucionem criminum guerris durantibus commissorum, prosecucione civili partibus reservata, dictusque Hugo, ad instigacionem suorum emulorum, occasione premissorum posset forsitam in futurum accusari vel vexari ; et propter hoc nobis humiliter supplicarunt ut, cumipse Hugo hactenus fuerit bone fame, velimus eidem super hoc nostre misericordie gremium apperire.
The corrected text is:
prediction.sentence:
Nunc nos, ut, prout nobis, fuit expositum ex parte amicorum carnalium Hugonis Guiberti, filii Thomae Guiberti, quod cum guerris durantibus ecclesia de Bellou in Pictavia per gentes nostras in dictis partibus existentes quodam modo fuisset debilitata, ne forsitan inimici eandem fortificarent, nichilominus Anglici et alii inimici regni nostri de die in diem predictum locum occupare volebant, prout vox et fama laborabant, quod attendentes parrochiani dicte ecclesie et alii circonvicini, timentes ne forsitan dicti inimici se ibidem manutenerent, dictus que Hugo, ad requestam plurium parrochianorum predictorum, una cum eisdem dictam ecclesiam fortificaverunt, causa sue tionis, et eandem contra dictos inimicos bene deffenderunt et pro eo pluria victualia et alia bona mobilia in et super patria acceperunt ; cum que carissimus primogenitus noster, dux Normannie, dum nobis absentibus regnum nostrum regebat, pace reformata inter nos et carissimum fratrem nostrum regem Anglie, fecerit generalem absolucionem criminum guerris durantibus commissorum, prosecucione civili partibus reservata, dictusque Hugo, ad instigacionem suorum emulorum, occasione premissorum posset forsitam in futurum accusari vel vexari ; et propter hoc nobis humiliter supplicarunt ut, cumipse Hugo hactenus fuerit bone fame, velimus eidem super hoc nostre misericordie gremium apperire.

OCR Text

Correct the spelling and grammar of the following words:

Incorrect text: O, what a day of joy it is! A boy's been born in the family of Mr. Smith of Puddington in Buckinghamshire, and
prediction.region: Incorrect text: Johannes, Dei gratia Francorum rex. Notum facimus universis, tam presentibus quam futuris, quod provi nobis humiliter fuit expositum ex parte amicorum carnalium Hugonis Guiberti, filii Thome Guiberti, quod cum guerris durantibus ecclesia de Bellou in Pictavia per gentes nostras in dictis partibus exisentes, quodem modo fuisset debilitata ne forsita inomici eandem fortificarent. nichilominus Anglici et alii inimici regni nostri de die in diem predictum locum accupare volebant, prout vot et fama laborabant, quod attendenter parrochi dicte ecclesie et alii circonitivi timentes ne forsitam dicti inimici, se ibidem ntiidenere dictusque Hugo ad requestem plurium parrochianorum predictorum, una cum eisdem dictam ecclesiam fortificaverunt causa suectionis, et eandem contra dictos inimicos ben deffenderunt et pro eo pluria victualia et alia bona mobilia in et super paria acceperunt, cumque carissimus primogenitus noster, dux Norman, dum nobis absentibus regnum nostrum regebat pace refor mata inter nos et carissimum fratrem nostrum regem Anglie fecerit generalem abolucionem criminum guerris durantibus commissorum prosecucione civili partibus reservata, dictusque Hugo ad instigacionem suorum emulorum, occasione premissorum potuerit quomodolibet incur risse, remittimus, quittamus ac tenore presencium penitus in dulgemus in casu premisso, ipsumque restituimus ad famam patriam et bona. Dantes, tenore presentium in mandatis senescall Pictavensis ceterisque justiciariis, officiaris nostris aut eorum loca tenentibus, presentibus pariter et futurus, quatinus dictum Hugonem, nostra presenti gracia uti et gaudere pacifice faciant et permittant ipsum in contrarium nullatenus molestantis aut molestari quomodolibet permittentes, sed si quis de bonis suis propter hoc captum seu saisitum extitit eidem volumus restitui indilate, quicquid secus factum vel attemptatum fuerit ad statum pristinum et debitum celeriter reducendo. Quod ut firmum et stabile permaneat in futurum, presentes litteras sigilli nostri mi miine facimus roborari. Salvo in aliis jure nostro et in omnibus quolibet alieno. Actum et Datum Parisius, anno Domini m coclx, mense juiii. Per regem, ad relacionem consilii in quo vos eratis. ferricus.</s>

ocr.sentence: Nos, attentis et consideratis premissis, prediclo litigoni facta supradicta ac cetera omnia alia, que sub dicta generali absolucione possunt et debent comprehandi, civili prosecucione duntaxat partibus reservata, atque omnem penam corporalem, criminalem et civilem, quas erga nos occasione premissorum potuerit quomodolibet incurrisse, remittimus, quittamus ac tenore presencium penitus indulgemus in casu premisso, ipsumque restituimus ad famam, patriam et bona.
ocr.region: Johannes, Dei gratia Francorum rex. Notum facimus universis, tam presentibus quam futuris, quod provi nobis humiliter fuit expositum ex parte amicorum carnalium Hugonis Guiberti, filii Thome Guiberti, quod cum guerris durantibus ecclesia de Bellou in Pictavia per gentes nostras in dictis partibus exisentes, quodem modo fuisset debilitata ne forsita inomici eandem fortificarent. nichilominus Anglici et alii inimici regni nostri de die in diem predictum locum accupare volebant, prout vot et fama laborabant, quod attendenter parrochi dicte ecclesie et alii circonitivi timentes ne forsitam dicti inimici, se ibidem ntiidenere dictusque Hugo ad requestem plurium parrochianorum predictorum, una cum eisdem dictam ecclesiam fortificaverunt causa sue tuicionis, et eandem contra dictos inimicos ben deffenderunt et pro eo pluria victualia et alia bona mobilia in et super paria acceperunt, cumque carissimus primogenitus noster, dux Norman, dum nobis absentibus regnum nostrum regebat pace refor mata inter nos et carissimum fratrem nostrum regem Anglie fecerit generalem abolucionem criminum guerris durantibus commissorum prosecucione civili partibus reservata, dictusque Hugo ad instigacionem suorum emulorum, occasione premissorum posset forsi tam in futurum accusari vel vexari, et propter hoc nobis humiliter supplicarant, ut cum ipse Hugo hactenus fuerit bone fame velimus eidem super hoc nostre misericordie gremium apparire. nos, attentis et consideratis premissis predicto Hugoni facta supradicta ac cetera omnia alia que sub dicta generali abolucione possunt et debent comprehandi, civili prosecucione dutapat partibus reserva ta atque omnem penam corporalem, criminalem et ciivilem, quas erga nos, occasione premissorum potuerit quomodolibet incur risse, remittimus, quittamus ac tenore presencium penitus in dulgemus in casu premisso, ipsumque restituimus ad famam patriam et bona. Dantes, tenore presentium in mandatis senescall Pictavensis ceterisque justiciariis, officiaris nostris aut eorum loca tenentibus, presentibus pariter et futurus, quatinus dictum Hugonem, nostra presenti gracia uti et gaudere pacifice faciant et permittant ipsum in contrarium nullatenus molestantis aut molestari quomodolibet permittentes, sed si quis de bonis suis propter hoc captum seu saisitum extitit eidem volumus restitui indilate, quicquid secus factum vel attemptatum fuerit ad statum pristinum et debitum celeriter reducendo. Quod ut firmum et stabile permaneat in futurum, presentes litteras sigilli nostri mi miine facimus roborari. Salvo in aliis jure nostro et in omnibus quolibet alieno. Actum et Datum Parisius, anno Domini m coclx, mense juiii. Per regem, ad relacionem consilii in quo vos eratis. ferricus.

groundtruth.region: Johannes, Dei gratia, Francorum rex. Notum facimus universis, tam presentibus quam futuris, quod, prout nobis humiliter fuit expositum ex parte amicorum carnalium Hugonis Guiberti, filii Thome Guiberti, quod cum guerris durantibus ecclesia de Bellou in Pictavia per gentes nostras in dictis partibus existentes quodam modo fuisset debilitata, ne forsitan inimici eandem fortificarent, nichilominus Anglici et alii inimici regni nostri de die in diem predictum locum occupare volebant, prout vox et fama laborabant, quod attendentes parrochiani dicte ecclesie et alii circonvicini, timentes ne forsitan dicti inimici se ibidem manutenerent, dictus que Hugo, ad requestam plurium parrochianorum predictorum, una cum eisdem dictam ecclesiam fortificaverunt, causa sue tuicionis, et eandem contra dictos inimicos bene deffenderunt et pro eo pluria victualia et alia bona mobilia in et super patria acceperunt ; cum que carissimus primogenitus noster, dux Normannie, dum nobis absentibus regnum nostrum regebat, pace reformata inter nos et carissimum fratrem nostrum regem Anglie, fecerit generalem absolucionem criminum guerris durantibus commissorum, prosecucione civili partibus reservata, dictusque Hugo, ad instigacionem suorum emulorum, occasione premissorum posset forsitam in futurum accusari vel vexari ; et propter hoc nobis humiliter supplicarunt ut, cumipse Hugo hactenus fuerit bone fame, velimus eidem super hoc nostre misericordie gremium apperire. Nos, attentis et consideratis premissis, prediclo litigoni facta supradicta ac cetera omnia alia, que sub dicta generali absolucione possunt et debent comprehandi, civili prosecucione duntaxat partibus reservata, atque omnem penam corporalem, criminalem et civilem, quas erga nos occasione premissorum potuerit quomodolibet incurrisse, remittimus, quittamus ac tenore presencium penitus indulgemus in casu premisso, ipsumque restituimus ad famam, patriam et bona. Dantes tenore presentium in mandatis senescallo Pictavensi ceterisque justiciariis, et officiariis nostris, atit eorum locatenentibus, presentibus pariter et futuris, quatinus dictum Hugonem nostra presenti gratia uti et gaudere pacifice faciant et permittant, ipsum in contrarium nullatenus molestantes aut molestari quomodolibet permitentes, sed si quis de bonis suis propter hoc captum seu saisitum extiterit eidem volumus restitui indilate, quodquid secus factum vel actemptatum fuerit ad statum prestinum et debitum celerint reducendo. Quod ut firmum et stabile permaneat in futurum, presentes litteras sigilli nostri munimine fecimus roborari. Salvo in aliis jure nostro et in omnibus quolibet alieno. Actum et dalum Parisius, anno Domini moccc lxio, mense junii. Per regem, ad relacionem consilii in quo vos eratis. Ferricus.
